title: Introducing: The Waffbags
content:
Alright, alright, so The Waffbags is a pretty horrendous name for an act.

It doesn’t roll off the tongue particularly elegantly, quite a contrast to the music in fact. If you’re not a fan of slightly cheesy, Scott Walker inspired 60’s ballads then The Waffbags are probably not for you. However, if like myself, you love charming sonnets and a sultry drawl that sounds as if it should belong in an American dinner, then you’re gonna lap this up.

Picture this. A near desolate cinema, a 1960’s classic romantic film flickers despairingly on the screen, whilst in the second row from the back, a young lad with slicked back hair stretches his arm around his petite woman. There’s a ballroom scene, soundtracked by After All Said And Done; the audience gasp as the hopelessly in love couple pirouette gracefully, before collapsing into a magnificent wooden four poster bed.

What More is a stunning piano led love song; the girl in the second row from the back is tearing up, as the lead singer weeps ‘there’s something about her eyes, what more could I ask for?’. This song is written for her. It has to be.

As the credits roll and the lovestruck young couple leave, the ever so slightly more jovial What A Shame plays, completing their nigh on perfect evening. This is where The Waffbags belong.
